storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view detailed conflict history to analyze and prevent recurring scheduling issues

testCases.title: Verify conflict logging and retrieval
preconditions: User has scheduler role with conflict history access permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
Conflict logs database is accessible and operational
At least one scheduling conflict exists in the system
Test data includes conflicts with various types and date ranges

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by attempting to book two appointments for the same resource at overlapping times
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and prevents the double booking

steps.action: Verify the conflict is logged by checking the conflict logs database
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is logged with complete details including timestamp, resource ID, conflicting appointment IDs, conflict type, and involved parties

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict history section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history UI loads successfully and displays the conflict history dashboard

steps.action: Apply date range filter to show conflicts from the last 7 days
steps.expectedResult: System displays only conflicts that occurred within the specified date range

steps.action: Apply resource filter to show conflicts for a specific resource
steps.expectedResult: System displays only conflicts involving the selected resource

steps.action: Apply conflict type filter to show specific conflict types
steps.expectedResult: System displays only conflicts matching the selected conflict type

steps.action: Verify the filtered conflict records display all required information including involved appointments and resolution status
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict record shows complete details: timestamp, resource, conflicting appointments, conflict type, resolution status, and involved parties

steps.action: Select export option and choose CSV format
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with format options including CSV, PDF, and Excel

steps.action: Confirm export and download the conflict history report
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated successfully and downloaded in CSV format containing all filtered conflict records with complete details

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file and verify data integrity
steps.expectedResult: CSV file contains accurate conflict data matching the filtered results displayed in the UI

postconditions: All conflicts remain logged in the database
Exported report is saved to the user's download folder
Audit log records the export action with user ID and timestamp
System state remains unchanged

testCases.title: Validate access control for conflict history
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: one without conflict history permissions and one with valid permissions
Both users are registered in the system
Conflict history data exists in the database
Access control rules are properly configured
Authentication system is operational

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of a user without conflict history access permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and reaches the main dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the conflict history section via the menu or direct URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and system displays an appropriate error message such as 'You do not have permission to access conflict history' or 'Access Denied - Insufficient Permissions'

steps.action: Verify that the conflict history menu option is either hidden or disabled for this user
steps.expectedResult: Conflict history option is not visible in the navigation menu or is displayed as disabled/grayed out

steps.action: Attempt to access conflict history via API endpoint GET /conflicts/history using the unauthorized user's token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of a user with valid conflict history access permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and reaches the main dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict history section from the menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted and the conflict history UI loads successfully displaying the conflict history dashboard

steps.action: Verify that conflict data is displayed with all details visible
steps.expectedResult: System displays conflict records with complete information including timestamps, resources, appointments, and resolution status

steps.action: Verify that the access attempt is logged in the audit log
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains entries for both the denied access attempt and the successful access with user IDs, timestamps, and action details

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains blocked from conflict history access
Authorized user retains access to conflict history
All access attempts are logged in the audit trail
No data is modified or compromised
System security remains intact

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to override scheduling conflicts with appropriate permissions to handle exceptional cases

testCases.title: Allow override with valid permissions
preconditions: User has scheduler role with override permissions enabled
User is logged into the scheduling system
A resource is already booked for a specific time slot
Scheduling database is accessible and operational
Audit logging system is active and functional
Override permission validation is configured correctly

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Appointment scheduling page loads successfully with all booking options available

steps.action: Select a resource that already has an appointment scheduled
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and calendar view shows existing appointment

steps.action: Attempt to create a new appointment for the same resource at an overlapping time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict

steps.action: Click Save or Submit to attempt saving the conflicting appointment
steps.expectedResult: System displays a conflict warning dialog showing details of the conflict including existing appointment information and the option to override

steps.action: Review the conflict details displayed in the warning dialog
steps.expectedResult: Conflict warning shows complete information: conflicting time slots, resource name, existing appointment details, and an 'Override' button is visible

steps.action: Click the 'Override' button to proceed with saving the conflicting appointment
steps.expectedResult: System validates user's override permissions and processes the override request

steps.action: Wait for system to complete the override processing
steps.expectedResult: System saves the conflicting appointment successfully within 2 seconds and displays a confirmation message such as 'Appointment saved successfully with conflict override'

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log or override log section
steps.expectedResult: Override log interface loads successfully

steps.action: Search for the most recent override entry using timestamp or appointment ID
steps.expectedResult: Override log entry is found and displayed

steps.action: Verify the override log entry contains all required details
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes user ID of the scheduler who performed the override, exact timestamp of the override action, conflict details including both appointment IDs, resource information, and override reason if provided

steps.action: Verify both appointments are now visible in the schedule for the same resource
steps.expectedResult: Calendar view shows both the original and the newly created appointment for the same resource at overlapping times, marked with conflict indicator

postconditions: Conflicting appointment is saved in the database
Override action is logged in audit trail with complete details
Both appointments remain active in the system
Resource shows double-booking in the schedule
System performance metrics show override completed within 2 seconds SLA

testCases.title: Prevent override without permissions
preconditions: User has scheduler role but does NOT have override permissions
User is logged into the scheduling system
A resource is already booked for a specific time slot
Permission validation system is properly configured
Scheduling database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of a user without override permissions
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and reaches the scheduling dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Appointment scheduling page loads successfully

steps.action: Select a resource that already has an appointment scheduled
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and calendar view displays the existing appointment

steps.action: Attempt to create a new appointment for the same resource at an overlapping time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the scheduling conflict

steps.action: Fill in all required appointment details and click Save or Submit
steps.expectedResult: System displays a conflict warning dialog showing details of the conflict

steps.action: Verify the conflict warning dialog does not show an override option
steps.expectedResult: Override button is either not visible or is disabled/grayed out due to insufficient permissions

steps.action: Attempt to save the appointment by clicking any available save or confirm button
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the save operation and displays an error message such as 'Cannot save conflicting appointment - Override permission required' or 'Access Denied - Insufficient permissions to override conflicts'

steps.action: Verify the appointment was not saved by checking the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Only the original appointment is visible in the schedule; the conflicting appointment was not created

steps.action: Check the database to confirm no new appointment record was created
steps.expectedResult: Database query confirms no new appointment exists for the attempted time slot

steps.action: Verify the failed override attempt is logged in the audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains an entry showing the denied override attempt with user ID, timestamp, and reason for denial (insufficient permissions)

postconditions: Conflicting appointment is NOT saved in the database
Original appointment remains unchanged
Failed override attempt is logged in audit trail
User receives clear error message about insufficient permissions
System security and access controls remain enforced
No unauthorized data modifications occurred

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view resource availability in real-time to make informed scheduling decisions

testCases.title: Display real-time resource availability
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and valid permissions
Resource availability dashboard is accessible
At least one resource exists in the system with known availability status
System is connected to scheduling databases and APIs
Real-time update mechanism is functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the resource availability dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Resource availability dashboard loads successfully and displays all available resources with their current status (Available, Booked, Unavailable)

steps.action: Verify that the displayed availability data matches the current state of resources in the system
steps.expectedResult: All resource availability statuses are accurate and reflect the current state, including upcoming bookings and time slots

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the availability dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Detailed availability view for the selected resource is displayed, showing time slots, bookings, and availability status

steps.action: Create a new appointment for the selected resource in a previously available time slot
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is created successfully and saved to the system

steps.action: Observe the resource availability dashboard and note the timestamp
steps.expectedResult: The availability status for the resource updates to reflect the new booking within 5 seconds, showing the time slot as now booked

steps.action: Modify an existing appointment by changing its time or duration to affect resource availability
steps.expectedResult: Appointment modification is saved successfully

steps.action: Monitor the resource availability dashboard for real-time updates
steps.expectedResult: The availability view updates within 5 seconds to reflect the modified appointment, showing updated available and booked time slots

steps.action: Attempt to schedule another appointment in a time slot that would create a conflict with existing bookings
steps.expectedResult: System displays conflict indicators clearly on the availability view, highlighting the overlapping time slots with visual markers (e.g., red highlighting, warning icons)

steps.action: Verify that conflict indicators are visible and accurately represent the scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are clearly marked with appropriate visual indicators, tooltips or messages explaining the nature of the conflict, and the conflicting appointments are identifiable

postconditions: Resource availability data reflects all changes made during the test
All created and modified appointments are saved in the system
Conflict indicators are displayed where applicable
Dashboard remains in a stable state for further use
Real-time update mechanism continues to function properly

testCases.title: Ensure secure access to resource availability data
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user accounts exist with different permission levels (with and without resource availability access)
Resource availability data exists in the system
Authentication and authorization mechanisms are active

steps.action: Log out from any existing session to ensure a clean test state
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Log in with a user account that does not have permissions to access resource availability data (e.g., a user with 'Guest' or 'Limited User' role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the resource availability dashboard through the application menu
steps.expectedResult: Resource availability dashboard option is either not visible in the menu or is disabled/grayed out

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the resource availability dashboard using the direct URL or endpoint (e.g., /resources/availability)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an appropriate error message (e.g., '403 Forbidden' or 'You do not have permission to access this resource'), and user is redirected to an error page or their home dashboard

steps.action: Verify that no resource availability data is displayed or accessible through any alternative navigation paths
steps.expectedResult: No resource availability information is visible or accessible to the unauthorized user

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out

steps.action: Log in with a user account that has valid permissions to access resource availability data (e.g., 'Scheduler' role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system with Scheduler privileges

steps.action: Navigate to the resource availability dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Resource availability dashboard option is visible and accessible in the menu

steps.action: Access the resource availability dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully and displays complete resource availability data including all resources, their statuses, bookings, and availability time slots

steps.action: Verify that all expected features and data are accessible (calendar view, timeline view, resource details, conflict indicators)
steps.expectedResult: All resource availability features and data are fully accessible and displayed correctly with no restrictions

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are logged in the system audit trail
Authorized user has full access to resource availability data
Security controls remain intact and functional
No unauthorized data exposure occurred during the test
User sessions are properly managed and secured
